page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY II
page.content: We can imagine the scene on a warm summer's evening as we hear the birds chirping,smell the perfumed roses hanging over the garden walls, hear the clattering of clogs along the street, and see the old people sitting chatting on benches beside the road. When people of Powfoot wanted to go to church,as there is no church in Powfoot,they crossed the hills to get to Cummertrees,and these hills are now called the 'Church Walk'.It is still used as a path,but not to go to church Nowadays people come to church in cars.The church has an unusual 'Lych Gate.' On it there is an inscription Which says "This Gate is a tribute to all those of this parish who served in the World Wars 1914-1919,1939-1945".
